intro: Dichromena velutina, commonly known as the velvet dichromena, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety stems and leaves, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Dichromena velutina is often found in moist, shady environments such as forest understories.
